name: Ensure S3 bucket policy does not grant Allow permission to everyone
body: The S3 bucket policy access permission settings are used to define who can access data and objects contained in a bucket. Users with access to S3 buckets are authorized to read, write, upload and delete objects and data in the bucket. This level of permission granted to Everyone may result in theft of data, compromised privacy, or unintended charges.
remediationDescription: In general, bucket policies are used for managing cross-account permissions. You can find out more in the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/access-policy-alternatives-guidelines.html). If this is the case, consider limiting the bucket policy only to specific principals. You can update the bucket policy from the **Permissions** tab of the S3 bucket.
